steps.title: Know the basics.
steps.content: Know the basics. There are 33 letters in the Russian alphabet. [1] X Research source It consists of 11 vowels, 20 consonants and 2 pronunciation signs. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Learn the Russian alphabet.
steps.content: Learn the Russian alphabet. It is: А, Б, В, Г, Д, Е, Ё, Ж, З, И, Й, К, Л, М, Н, О, П, Р, С, Т, У, Ф, Х, Ц, Ч, Ш, Щ, Ъ, Ы, Ь, Э, Ю, Я. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Figure out what it translates to.
steps.content: Figure out what it translates to. In English the Russian alphabet translates to: a, b, v, g, d, e, yo, zh, z, i, y, k, l, m, n, o, p, r, s, t, u, f, kh, ts, ch,sh, shch, 'hard sign', i, 'soft sign', ye, yu, ya. As you can see there are a lot of letters that represent sounds, e.g. Ж = zh. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Find letters that are similar to the ones you already know in English.
steps.content: Find letters that are similar to the ones you already know in English. Russian letters that are basically the same: Aa = pronounced like the 'a' in car (not like the flat 'a' in mat). Kk = pronounced like the 'k' in kitchen. Mm = pronounced like the 'm' in mail. Oo = pronounced like the 'o' in bore. Tt = pronounced like the 't' in top. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Learn the letters that look like they're from the English alphabet, but are pronounced differently.
steps.content: Learn the letters that look like they're from the English alphabet, but are pronounced differently. Russian letters that look like English letters but sound different are: B = pronounced like the 'v' in vet. E = pronounced like the 'ye' in yes. H = pronounced like the 'n' in no. P = pronounced like the 'r' in rabbit (the 'P' is rolled though), C = pronounced like the 's' in snake. Y = pronounced like the 'oo' in shoot. X = pronounced like the 'h' in hello (similar sound to the ending of 'Bach' in German). [6] X Research source

steps.title: Learn the letters that have similar sounds in English, but look different from any letters in the English alphabet.
steps.content: Learn the letters that have similar sounds in English, but look different from any letters in the English alphabet. Russian letters that look unfamiliar, but have similar sounds in English are: Б = pronounced like 'b' in bread. Г = pronounced like 'g' in great. Д = pronounced like 'd' in dark. З = pronounced like 'z' in zoo. И = pronounced like 'i' in taxi. Л = pronounced like 'L' in like. П = pronounced like 'p' in person. Ф = pronounced like 'f' in fish. Э = pronounced like 'e' in bet. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Learn letters that are unique to Russian, yet still have similar sounds.
steps.content: Learn letters that are unique to Russian, yet still have similar sounds. These letters are: Ё = pronounced like 'yo' in yonder. Ю = sounds just like the word 'you'. Я = pronounced like the 'ya' in yacht. Ж = sounds like the 's' in pleasure. Ц = pronounced 'ts' like in sits. Ч = pronounced like 'ch' in church. Ш = sounds like 'sh' in sharp. Щ = to say this letter you have to arrange your mouth as if you were going to say 'ch' but instead you would say 'sh'. Ы = pronounced like the 'i' in lip. Й = sounds like the 'y' in boy. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Figure out the pronunciation symbols.
steps.content: Figure out the pronunciation symbols. Ъ = the 'hard sign' represents a slight pause between syllables. Ь = the 'soft sign' makes the previous letter soft, so 'K' sound could sound like a 'H' if this symbol was after the 'K'. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Start reading simple words.
steps.content: Start reading simple words. [10] X Research source Some example words are: БAP = BAR (not BAP!), ВИДЕО = VIDEO, ТЕКСТ = TEXT, MИHУTA = MINUTE, ИЮHЬ = JUNE, СЕНТЯБРЬ = SEPTEMBER.
